TestDescription.name: Apache 2.x version older than 2.2.3

WASPDescription.DetailsFormat: The script has been tested with these parameter values : ${combinations}

TestDescription.Description:
[coolbox][dark]This alert was generated using only banner information. It may be a false positive. [/dark][/coolbox][break][bold]Fixed in Apache httpd 2.2.3:[/bold][break][ul]
[li] [bold]important[/bold]: mod_rewrite off-by-one error CVE-2006-3747[break]
An off-by-one flaw exists in the Rewrite module, mod_rewrite. Depending on the manner in which Apache httpd was compiled, this software defect may result in a vulnerability which, in combination with certain types of Rewrite rules in the web server configuration files, could be triggered remotely. For vulnerable builds, the nature of the vulnerability can be denial of service (crashing of web server processes) or potentially allow arbitrary code execution. [/li]
[/ul][break]
[navy]Affected Apache versions (up to 2.2.2).[/navy][break]
TestDescription.Impact: Check references for details about every vulnerability.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade Apache 2.x to the latest version.
